questionTitle: When I was a child I always wanted to ________ to play the piano.
I can't make ________ what's happening.
I've put on so much weight that my clothes don't ________ me any more.
He's such a naughty child; it's amazing what his mother lets him ________ away with.
Bob ________ to the hospital five minutes before the birth of his daughter.
He took the trouble to write ________ the complete list for us.
________ the papers, the Prime Minister is giving a speech on the economy tomorrow.
Clearing the weeds from the churchyard was a much harder ________ than the children had imagined it would be.
It is a minor road and very narrow and ________ in places.
My application for a trading licence was ________.
I am very fond of Graham Greene's novels. He is my ________ modern author.
Jane studied zoology at university and ________.
Biting one's fingernails is a very bad ________.
Are you saying you want me to work all weekend? You ________ be serious.
He is so keen ________ learning, you should encourage him in his efforts.
Don't blame me ________ that!
I don't think he actually had ________ me about his problems.
The judge shouted to counsel on both sides that he would ________ no argument on the issue and enjoined them to ________.
Leadville was ________ out when the silver boom collapsed in 1893.
The politician rehearsed his speech again and again until he was unsure that he was word ________.
